data.quote: Every hero becomes a bore at last.

data.quote: When the historian  Charles A. Beard was asked about the lessons from history  he said there were four: 1. The bee fertilizes the flower it robs. 2. Whom the gods would destroy  they first make mad with power. 3. The mills of God grind slowly  but they grind exceeding small. 4. When it is dark enough  you can see the stars.

data.quote: No person was ever honoured for what he received. Honour has been the reward for what he gave.

data.quote: It is better to deserve honours and not have them than to have them and not deserve them.
data.author: Mark Twain

data.quote: A man has honour if he holds himself to an ideal of conduct though it is inconvenient  unprofitable or dangerous to do so.
data.author: Walter Lippmann

data.quote: The louder he talked of his honour  the faster we counted our spoons.
data.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

data.quote: Honour follows those who flee it.

data.quote: God sells knowledge for labour - honour for risk.
data.author: Arabic proverb

data.quote: Fame is something which must be won  honour is something which must not be lost.

data.quote: Dignity does not consist in possessing honours  but in deserving them.

data.quote: I could not love thee  dear  so much Loved I not honour more.

data.quote: Honour pricks me on. Yea  but how if honour prick me off when I come on? How then? Can honour set to a leg? No. Or an arm? No. Or take away the grief of a wound? No. Honour hath no skill in surgery  then? No. What is honour? A word.
data.author: William Shakespeare

data.quote: Would that ... a sense of the true aim of life might elevate the tone of politics and trade till public and private honour become identical.
data.author: Margaret Fuller

data.quote: No revenge is more honorable than the one not taken.
data.author: Spanish proverb

data.quote: An act of God was defined as something which no reasonable man could have expected.
data.author: A. P. Herbert

data.quote: It is a long lane that has no turning.
data.author: Old saying

data.quote: Everyone who has ever built anywhere a "new heaven" first found the power thereto in his own hell.
data.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

data.quote: Hope is a pleasant acquaintance  but an unsafe friend.

data.quote: We do not really feel grateful toward those who make our dreams come true  they ruin our dreams.
data.author: Eric Hoffer

data.quote: When you get to the end of your rope  tie a knot and hang on.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: For what human ill does not dawn seem to be an alleviation?

data.quote: Hope is itself a species of happiness  and  perhaps  the chief happiness which this world affords.
data.author: Samuel Johnson

data.quote: Hope  deceitful as it is  serves at least to lead us to the end of life along an agreeable road.
data.author: La Rochefoucauld

data.quote: One need not hope in order to undertake  nor succeed in order to persevere.

data.quote: Hope! of all ills that men endure The only cheap and universal cure.

data.quote: Hope is the poor man's bread.
data.author: George Herbert

data.quote: Hope springs eternal in the human breast  Man never is  but always to be blest.
data.author: Alexander Pope

data.quote: I suppose it can be truthfully said that hope is the only universal liar who never loses his reputation for veracity.

data.quote: Every thing that is done in the world is done by hope.

data.quote: Hope is a good breakfast  but it is a bad supper.

data.quote: Man's many desires are like the small metal coins he carries about in his pocket. The more he has the more they weight him down.

data.quote: The human body experiences a powerful gravitational pull in the direction of hope. That is why the patient's hopes are the physician's secret weapon. They are the hidden ingredients in any prescription.

data.quote: Some one once said to me  'Reverend Schuller  I hope you live to see all your dreams fulfilled.' I replied  T hope not  because if I live and all my dreams are fulfilled  I'm dead.' It's unfulfilled dreams that keep you alive.

data.quote: The slow compromise  or even surrender  of our fondest hopes is a regular feature of normal human life.
data.author: Leston L. Havens

data.quote: Hope is an echo  hope ties itself yonder  yonder.

data.quote: 'Hope' is the thing with feathers That perches in the soul - And sings the tune without words And never stops - at all.
data.author: Emily Dickinson

data.quote: It is characteristic of genius to be hopeful and aspiring.
data.author: Harriet Martineau

data.quote: If it were not for hopes  the heart would break.

data.quote: None are completely wretched but those who are without hope  and few are reduced so low as that.

data.quote: Wonder ... music heard in the heart  is voiceless.
data.author: Rosemary Dobson

data.quote: To all the living there is hope  for a living dog is better than a dead lion.
data.author: Bible

data.quote: Everybody lives for something better to come.

data.quote: Hope is itself a species of happiness  and  perhaps  the chief happiness which this world affords.
data.author: Samuel Johnson

data.quote: At first we hope too much  later on  not enough.

data.quote: We should not let our fears hold us back from pursuing our hopes.

data.quote: Great hopes make great men.

data.quote: Hope is one of those things in life you cannot do without.

data.quote: It has never been  and never will be  easy work! But the road that is built in hope is more pleasant to the traveler than the road built in despair  even though they both lead to the same destination.

data.quote: And thou shalt be secure because there is hope.

data.quote: Hope! Of all the ills that men endure  the only cheap and universal cure.

data.quote: Our greatest good  and what we least can spare  is hope.

data.quote: Hope is the last thing that dies in man.

data.quote: Hope is the last thing ever lost.

data.quote: My faith is important. I have nothing without it.

data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: Hope is the last thing to abandon the unhappy.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: The miserable have no medicine but hope.

data.quote: Hope is the second soul of the unhappy.

data.quote: Hope is the positive mode of awaiting the future.

data.quote: All shall be well  and all shall be well  and all manner of things shall be well.

data.quote: Clouds and darkness surround us  yet heaven is just  and the day of triumph will surely come  when justice and truth will be vindicated. Our wrongs will be made right  and we will once more taste the blessings of freedom.

data.quote: If winter comes  can spring be far behind?

data.quote: Hope and patience are two sovereign remedies for all  the surest reposals  the softest cushions to lean on in adversity.

data.quote: Patience is the art of hoping.

data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: While there's life  there's hope.

data.quote: Hope is the poor man's bread.

data.quote: Oh  what a valiant faculty is hope.

data.quote: Hope springs eternal in the human breast.
data.author: Alexander Pope

data.quote: Hope deferred maketh the heart sick.

data.quote: Hope is the poor man's bread.
data.author: Thales

data.quote: You may lead a horse to water but you can't make him drink.
data.author: English proverb

data.quote: One white foot - buy him: Two white feet - try him  Three white feet - look well about him  Four white feet - go without him.
data.author: Old English Rhyme

data.quote: A horse! a horse! my kingdom for a horse!

data.quote: Let me live in my house by the side of the road  And be a friend to man.
data.author: Sam Walter Foss

data.quote: For 't is always fair weather When good fellows get together With a stein on the table and a good song ringing clear.

data.quote: I was an hungered  and ye gave me meat: I was thirsty and ye gave me drink. I was a stranger  and ye took me in.
data.author: Matthew

data.quote: For I  who hold sage Homer's rule the best  Welcome the coming  speed the going guest.

data.quote: Oh that I had in the wilderness a lodging-place of wayfaring men!
data.author: Bible

data.quote: Houses are built to live in  and not to look on.

data.quote: Fools build houses  and wise men buy them.

data.quote: He that lives in a glass house must not throw stones.

data.quote: A foolish man... built his house upon the sand.

data.quote: I wish everybody would go back into the closet.

data.quote: Modern dancers give a sinister portent about our times. The dancers don't even look at one another. They are just a lot of isolated individuals jiggling in a kind of self-hypnosis and dancing with others only to remind themselves that we are not completely alone in this world.

data.quote: One kind word can warm three winter months.
data.author: Japanese saying

data.quote: Outside  among your fellows  among strangers  you must preserve appearances  100 things you cannot do  but inside  the terrible freedom!
data.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

data.quote: The easiest kind of relationship for me is with 10 000 people. The hardest is with one.

data.quote: The opinions which we hold of one another  our relations with friends and kinsfolk are in no sense permanent  save in appearance  but are as eternally fluid as the sea itself.

data.quote: When the man is at home  his standing in society is well known and quietly taken  but when he is abroad  it is problematical  and is dependent on the success of his manners.

data.quote: When you live next to the cemetery  you cannot weep for everyone.

data.quote: When you meet anyone in the flesh you realize immediately that he is a human being and not a sort of caricature embodying certain ideas. It is partly for this reason that I don't mix much in literary circles  because I know from experience that once I have met and spoken to anyone I shall never again be able to feel any intellectual brutality towards him  even when I feel I ought to - like the Labour M.P.s who get patted on the back by dukes and are lost forever more.
data.author: George Orwell

data.quote: The wisest man I have ever known once said to me: 'Nine out of every ten people improve on acquaintance ' and I have found his words true.
data.author: Frank Swinnerton

data.quote: I am a part of all that I have met.
data.author: Lord Tennyson

data.quote: At the heart of our friendly or purely social relations  there lurks a hostility momentarily cured but recurring in fits and starts.
data.author: Marcel Proust

data.quote: The worst sin towards our fellow creatures is not to hate them  but to be indifferent to them  that's the essence of inhumanity.
data.author: George Bernard Shaw

data.quote: We rarely confide in those who are better than we are.
data.author: Albert Camus

data.quote: A sense of duty is useful in work  but offensive in personal relations. People wish to be liked  not be endured with patient resignation.
data.author: Bertrand Russell

data.quote: The fact is that the possession of a highly social conscience about large-scale issues is no guarantee whatever of reasonable conduct in private relations.
data.author: Lewis Hastings

data.quote: With three or more people there is something bold in the air: direct things get said which would frighten two people alone and conscious of each inch of their nearness to one another. To be three is to be in public - you feel safe.
data.author: Elizabeth Bowen

data.quote: Acquaintance  n: a person whom we know well enough to borrow from  but not well enough to lend to.
data.author: Ambrose Bierce

data.quote: In any relationship we feel an unconscious need to create  as it were  a new picture  a new edition of ourselves to present to the fresh person who claims our interest  for them  we in a strange sense wish to  and do  start life anew.
data.author: Ann N. Bridge

data.quote: Make yourself necessary to somebody.
data.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

data.quote: Only the person who has faith in himself is able to be faithful to others.
data.author: Erich Fromm

data.quote: We accept every person in the world as that for which he gives himself out  only he must give himself out for something. We can put up with the unpleasant more easily than we can endure the insignificant.
data.author: Goethe

data.quote: Each of us keeps  battened down inside himself  a sort of lunatic giant -impossible socially  but full-scale. It's the knockings and batterings we sometimes hear in each other that keep our intercourse from utter banality.
data.author: Elizabeth Bowen

data.quote: We wander through this life together in a semi-darkness in which none of us can distinguish exactly the features of his neighbour. Only from time to time  through some experience that we have of our companion  or through some remark that he passes  he stands for a moment close to us  as though illuminated by a flash of lightning. Then we see him as he really is.
data.author: Albert Schweitzer

data.quote: A loving person lives in a loving world. A hostile person lives in a hostile world: everyone you meet is your mirror.
data.author: Ken Keyes

data.quote: It is always safe to assume that people are more subtle and less sensitive than they seem.
data.author: Eric Hoffer

data.quote: I was born modest  not all over  but in spots.
data.author: Mark Twain

data.quote: A modest man is usually admired - if people ever hear of him.
data.author: Edgar Watson Howe

data.quote: When the Quaker Penn kept his hat on in the royal presence  Charles (King Charles II) politely removed his  explaining that it was the custom in that place for only one person at a time to remain covered.
data.author: Arthur Bryant

data.quote: If you treat men the way they are you never improve them. If you treat them the way you want them to be  you do.
data.author: Goethe

data.quote: See everything: overlook a great deal: correct a little.
data.author: Pope John XXIII

data.quote: The more you let yourself go  the less others let you go.
data.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

data.quote: A hundred times every day I remind myself that my inner and outer life depend on the labours of other men  living and dead  and that I must exert myself in order to give in the same measure as I have received.
data.author: Albert Einstein

data.quote: At bottom the world isn't a joke. We only joke about it to avoid an issue with someone  to let someone know that we know he's there with his questions  to disarm him by seeming to have heard and done justice to his side of the standing argument.
data.author: Robert Frost

data.quote: I reckon there's as much human nature in some folks as there is in others  if not more.
data.author: Edward Noyes Westcott

data.quote: If only there were evil people somewhere  insidiously committing evil deeds  and it were necessary only to separate them from the rest of us and destroy them. But the line dividing good and evil cuts through the heart of every human being. And who is willing to destroy a piece of his own heart?
data.author: Aleksandr Solzhenitsyn

data.quote: Science may have found a cure for most evils: but it has found no remedy for the worst of them all - the apathy of human beings.
data.author: Helen Keller

data.quote: The go-between wears out a thousand sandals.
data.author: Japanese proverb

data.quote: Life is livable because we know that wherever we go most of the people we meet will be restrained in their actions toward us by an almost instinctive network of taboos.
data.author: Havelock Ellis

data.quote: I was taught when I was young that if people would only love one another  all would be well with the world. This seemed simple and very nice  but I found when I tried to put it in practice not only that other people were seldom lovable  but that I was not very lovable myself.
data.author: George Bernard Shaw

data.quote: It is well to remember that the entire population of the universe  with one trifling exception  is composed of others.
data.author: John Andrew Holmes

data.quote: Our concern is not how to worship in the catacombs but how to remain human in the skyscrapers.
data.author: Abraham J. Heschel

data.quote: Our humanity were a poor thing but for the divinity that stirs within us.
data.author: Sir Francis Bacon

data.quote: I love my country better than my family  but I love humanity better than my country.
data.author: Francois Fenelon

data.quote: Wen you see a man in woe  Walk right up and say "hullo." Say "hullo" and "how d'ye do " "How's the world a-usin' you?"
data.author: Sam Walter Foss

data.quote: He held his seat  a friend to human race.
data.author: Homer

data.quote: Humanitarianism consists in never sacrificing a human being to a purpose.
data.author: Albert Schweitzer

data.quote: Oh  God! that bread should be so dear  And flesh and blood so cheap!
data.author: Thomas Hood

data.quote: Every human heart is human.
data.author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

data.quote: After all there is but one race - humanity.
data.author: George Moore

data.quote: The world is my country  all mankind are my brethren  and to do good is my religion.
data.author: Thomas Paine

data.quote: Humanity is the Son of God.
data.author: Theodore Parker

data.quote: I am not an Athenian  nor a Greek  but a citizen of the world.
data.author: Socrates

data.quote: The age of chivalry has gone  the age of humanity has come.
data.author: Charles Sumner

data.quote: I am a man  I count nothing human foreign to me.
data.author: Terence

data.quote: Our true nationality is mankind.
data.author: H. G. Wells

data.quote: After crosses and losses  men grow humbler and wiser.
data.author: Benjamin Franklin

data.quote: 'Umble we are  'umble we have been  'umble we shall ever be.
data.author: Charles Dickens

data.quote: In humility imitate Jesus and Socrates.
data.author: Benjamin Franklin

data.quote: I believe the first test of a truly great man is his humility.
data.author: John Ruskin

data.quote: My wife never lies about her age. She just tells everyone she's as old as I am. Then she lies about my age.
data.author: Robert Orben

data.quote: The best contraceptive for old people is nudity.
data.author: Phyllis Diller

data.quote: My health is good  it's my age that's bad.
data.author: Roy Acuff

data.quote: He's so old his social security number is two digits.
data.author: Brian Morgan

data.quote: The best way to remember your wife's birthday is to forget it once.
data.author: E. Joseph Cossman

data.quote: She's too young for Medicare and too old for me to care.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: There are three signs of old age: loss of memory ... I forget the other two.
data.author: Red Skelton

data.quote: Once my wife gave me a wonderful birthday present. She let me win an argument.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: If you want to know how old a woman is . . . ask her sister-in-law.
data.author: Edgar Howe

data.quote: My wife loves Europe  but to me it's a bad day at a theme park.
data.author: Jay Leno

data.quote: Hollywood is a place where people from Iowa mistake each other for movie stars.
data.author: Fred Allen

data.quote: It is possible to live in San Francisco for $35 000 a year. Obviously  that doesn't include food or lodging.
data.author: Kenn Carlson

data.quote: Miami bumper sticker: My horn is broken-so watch for my finger.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: Flying from the U.S. to Tokyo takes approximately as long as law school.
data.author: Dave Barry

data.quote: France is the only country where the money falls apart and you can't tear the toilet paper.
data.author: Billy Wilder

data.quote: When people ask me if I have any spare change  I tell them I have it at home in my spare wallet.
data.author: Nick Arnette

data.quote: My wife is a sex object - every time I ask for sex  she objects.
data.author: Les Dawson

data.quote: You're not drunk if you can lie on the floor without holding on.
data.author: Dean Martin

data.quote: My sister says she never seems to get it together . . . either her rear looks good or her face does.
data.author: Sally Bucko

data.quote: I wanted to marry her when I saw the moonlight shining on the barrel of her father's shotgun.

data.quote: I was the best man at the wedding. So why is she marrying him?

data.quote: Father giving advice to son: Never do anything once around the house that you don't want to do for the rest of your life.
data.author: Frank Briggs

data.quote: Marriage is like a violin. After the beautiful music is over  the strings are still attached.
data.author: Jacob Braude

data.quote: My husband will never chase another woman. He's too fine  too decent  too old.
data.author: Grade Allen

data.quote: Never get married in the morning  because you never know who you'll meet that night.
data.author: Paul Hornung

data.quote: When my wife was asked  "Do you take this man for richer or poorer . . ." she answered  "For richer."

data.quote: "So you want to become my son-in-law." "Not exactly. I just want to marry your daughter."
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: I remember when I got married. I remember where I got married. But for the life of me  I can't remember why I got married.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: American women expect to find in their husbands a perfection that English women only hope to find in their butlers.
data.author: W. Somerset Maugham

data.quote: Behind every successful man you'll find a woman who has nothing to wear.

data.quote: Men have a much better time of it than women. For one thing  they marry later. For another thing  they die earlier.
data.author: H. L. Mencken

data.quote: A man is a person who will pay two dollars for a one-dollar item he wants. A woman will pay one dollar for a two-dollar item she doesn't want.
data.author: William Binger

data.quote: All women become like their mothers. That is their tragedy. No man does. That's his.
data.author: Oscar Wilde

data.quote: A man should be taller  older  heavier  uglier and hoarser than his wife.
data.author: Edgar Watson Howe

data.quote: Men like cars  women like clothes. Women only like cars because they take them to clothes.

data.author: Don Herold

data.quote: Humour plays close to the big  hot fire  which is the truth  and the reader feels the heat.
data.author: E. B. White

data.quote: Wit is the only wall Between us and the dark.
data.author: Mark Van Doren

data.quote: Look at Jewish history. Unrelieved lamenting would be intolerable. So  for every ten Jews beating their breasts  God designated one to be crazy and amuse the breast-beaters. By the time I was five I knew I was that one.
data.author: Mel Brooks

data.quote: Mirthfulness is in the mind and you cannot get it out. It is just as good in its place as conscience or veneration.
data.author: Henry Ward Beecher

data.quote: Novelist Peter de Vries  like Adlai Stevenson and Mark Twain  has suffered from the American assumption that anyone with a sense of humour is not to be taken seriously.
data.author: Timothy Foote

data.quote: Humour can be dissected  as a frog can  but the thing dies in the process.
data.author: E. B. White

data.quote: Humour is the contemplation of the finite from the point of view of the infinite.
data.author: Christian Morgenstern

data.quote: The total absence of humour from the Bible is one of the most singular things in all literature.
data.author: Alfred North Whitehead

data.quote: Laughter is the closest thing to the grace of God.
data.author: Karl Barth

data.quote: Humour is richly rewarding to the person who employs it. It has some value in gaining and holding attention. But it has no persuasive value at all.
data.author: J. K. Galbraith

data.quote: Humour is the most engaging cowardice. With it myself I have been able to hold some of my enemy in play far out of gunshot.
data.author: Robert Frost

data.quote: A comedian is a fellow who finds other comedians too humorous to mention.
data.author: Jack Herbert

data.quote: If it's sanity you're after There's no recipe like Laughter. Laugh it off.
data.author: Henry Rutherford Elliot

data.quote: Humour is an affirmation of dignity  a declaration of man's superiority to all that befalls him.
data.author: Romain Gary

data.quote: Comedy is simply a funny way of being serious.
data.author: Peter Ustinov

data.quote: Comedy is tragedy - plus time.
data.author: Carol Burnett

data.quote: Caricature: putting the face of a joke upon the body of a truth.
data.author: Joseph Conrad

data.quote: The ability to laugh at life is right at the top  with love and communication  in the hierarchy of our needs. Humour has much to do with pain  it exaggerates the anxieties and absurdities we feel  so that we gain distance and through laughter  relief.
data.author: Sara Davidson

data.quote: He deserves paradise who makes his companions laugh.
data.author: The Koran

data.quote: Laughter is the shortest distance between two people.
data.author: Victor Borge

data.quote: You encourage a comic man too much  and he gets silly.
data.author: Stephen Leacock

data.quote: Any man will admit if need be that his sight is not good  or that he cannot swim or shoots badly with a rifle  but to touch upon his sense of humour is to give him mortal affront.
data.author: Stephen Leacock

data.quote: Anything awful makes me laugh. I misbehaved once at a funeral.
data.author: Charles Lamb

data.quote: Wit is far more often a shield than a lance.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: If there's anything I hate it's the word humorist - I feel like countering with the word seriousist.
data.author: Peter de Vries

data.quote: A jest's prosperity lies in the ear Of him that hears it  never in the tongue Of him that makes it.
data.author: William Shakespeare

data.quote: Nonsense is an assertion of man's spiritual freedom in spite of all the oppressions of circumstance.
data.author: Aldous Huxley

data.quote: Humour is just another defence against the universe.
data.author: Mel Brooks

data.quote: The great humorist forgets himself in his delighted contemplation of other people.
data.author: Douglas Bush

data.quote: The role of a comedian is to make the audience laugh  at a minimum of once every fifteen seconds.
data.author: Lenny Bruce

data.quote: Laughter is the sensation of feeling good all over  and showing it principally in one spot.
data.author: Josh Billings

data.quote: He who laughs  lasts.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: We are all here for a spell  get all the good laughs you can.
data.author: Will Rogers

data.quote: No one is more profoundly sad than he who laughs too much.
data.author: Jean Paul Richter

data.quote: A joke is an epigram on the death of a feeling.
data.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

data.quote: One loses so many laughs by not laughing at oneself.
data.author: Sara Jeannette Duncan

data.quote: You can pretend to be serious  but you can't pretend to be witty.
data.author: Sacha Guitry

data.quote: Charles Dickens' creation of Mr. Pickwick did more for the elevation of the human race - I say it in all seriousness - than Cardinal Newman's Lead Kindly Light Amid the Encircling Gloom. Newman only cried out for light in the gloom of a sad world. Dickens gave it.
data.author: Stephen Leacock

data.quote: The love of truth lies at the root of much humour.
data.author: Robertson Davies

data.quote: An empty stomach is not a good political adviser.
data.author: Albert Einstein

data.quote: If thine enemy- be hungry  give him bread to eat.
data.author: Proverbs

data.quote: A hungry people listens not to reason  nor cares for justice  nor is bent by any prayers.
data.author: Seneca

data.quote: Yond Cassius has a lean and hungry look.
data.author: William Shakespeare

data.quote: All husbands are alike  but they have different faces so you can tell them apart.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: A good husband should be deaf and a good wife blind.
data.author: French proverb

data.quote: A good husband is never the first to go to sleep at night or the last to awake in the morning.
data.author: Honore de Balzac

data.quote: Husbands  love your wives  even as Christ also loved the church  and gave himself for it.
data.author: Ephesians

data.quote: A man should be taller  older  heavier  uglier  and hoarser than his wife.
data.author: E. W. Howe

data.quote: Men are April when they woo  December when they wed.
data.author: William Shakespeare

data.quote: As the husband is  the wife is.
data.author: Lord Alfred Tennyson

data.quote: Man is the only animal that can remain on friendly terms with the victims he intends to eat until he eats them.
data.author: Samuel Butler

data.quote: Hypocrisy is the homage which vice pays to virtue.
data.author: La Rochefoucauld

data.quote: He that hath the name to be an early riser may sleep till noon.
data.author: James Howell

data.quote: We are not hypocrites in our sleep.
data.author: William Hazlitt

data.quote: No man is a hypocrite in his pleasures.
data.author: Samuel Johnson

data.quote: The wolf was sick  he vowed a monk to be - But when he got well  a wolf once more was he.
data.author: Walter Bower

data.quote: Remember this: If you work for a man  in Heaven's name  work for him. If he pays you wages which supply you bread and butter  work for him  speak well of him  stand by the institution he represents. If put to a pinch  an ounce of loyalty is worth a pound of cleverness. If you must vilify  condemn and eternally disparage - resign your position  and when you are on the outside  damn to your heart's content  but as long as you are part of the institution do not condemn it.
data.author: Elbert Hubbard

data.quote: For neither man nor angel can discern hypocrisy  the only evil that walks invisible.
data.author: John Milton

data.quote: The teeth are smiling  but is the heart?
data.author: Congo proverb

data.quote: Affectation is a greater enemy to the face than smallpox.
data.author: English proverb

data.quote: It is a trick among the dishonest to offer sacrifices that are not needed  or not possible  to avoid making those that are required.
data.author: Ivan Goncharov

data.quote: When you say that you agree to a thing in principle  you mean that you have not the slightest intention of carrying it out.
data.author: Otto von Bismarck

data.quote: An appeaser is one who feeds a crocodile - hoping it will eat him last.
data.author: Winston Churchill

data.quote: There is luxury in self-reproach. When we blame ourselves we feel that no one else has the right to blame us.
data.author: Oscar Wilde

data.quote: Extremes meet  and there is no better example than the naughtiness of humility.
data.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

data.quote: Hypocrite - mouth one way  belly 'nother way.
data.author: Australian Aboriginal proverb

data.quote: When the fox preaches  look to your geese.
data.author: German proverb

data.quote: I hope you have not been leading a double life  pretending to be wicked and being really good all the time. That would be hypocrisy.
data.author: Oscar Wilde

data.quote: Reasons are whores.
data.author: Leonard Michaels

data.quote: Saint abroad  and a devil at home.
data.author: John Bunyan

data.quote: Every man is a hypocrite
data.author: Frederick IV

data.quote: Hypocrites do the devil's drudgery in Christ's livery.
data.author: Matthew Henry

data.quote: Hypocrisy is the homage which vice renders to virtue.
data.author: La Rochefoucauld

data.quote: Who stole the livery of the court of Heaven To serve the Devil in.
data.author: Frederick Pollock
